metadata.name: Ordinary Places #223
metadata.description:
‚ÄúOrdinary Places‚Äù is a fully-coded meditation on the poetic beauty of everyday landscapes. 

The architectural characters in these landscapes include water towers (inspired by Bernd & Hilla Becher‚Äôs ‚ÄúWater Tower‚Äù photography series), gas stations (inspired by Ed Ruscha‚Äôs ‚Äú26 Gasoline Stations‚Äù photography book), and barns (inspired by childhood memories on my grandfather‚Äôs farm). 

Yet, while these scenes may seem ordinary upon first glance, something darker lurks beneath the surface. The hidden secrets of these Ordinary Places can only be revealed through the minting process. In this sense, the outputs are not merely a collection individual scenes, but instead, a coherent world animated by shared themes and narratives.     

Pressing the down arrow saves the coded output as a .png image.

metadata.name: symphony redux #81
metadata.description:
subject to interpretation, but inspired by JAM Whistler's Nocturne in Black and Gold

symphony was released on fx(hash) on December 21, 2021, with largely broken preview images. symphony redux is an update of the symphony code, with working previews and a few extra features.

controls:
s -- save as png
space bar -- pause/unpause
1-6 -- pixel density

metadata.name: el inefable momento #1153
metadata.description:
"el inefable momento del colorido descubrimiento" ("the ineffable moment of the colorful discovery")  is part of the fxhash interactive minting experience at The Ever-Evolving World of Art, Art Basel Hong-Kong, 2022.

It is a tribute to playful discovery. This work was commissioned for the Art Basel Hong Kong / Tezos / fxhash collaboration, as part of an activity to introduce visitors into generative art. As I was pondering what could I do in the short time available, I saw my youngest daughter drawing: the ineffable moment of colorful discovery. Child play is one of the most discovery-filled activities I can think of. And drawing is that joy that I describe: a blank piece of paper with a crayon is pure possibility. Which is what generative art is. I had wanted for quite some time to create a tribute to those drawings my daughters do, and this has been the perfect occasion to start it: it seemed to me that it fit the occasion perfectly: kids discover through painting, maybe adults can discover generative art using the same visual language.

"el inefable momento del colorido descubrimiento" is a work that explores colour and irregular basic shapes, and that leaves the viewer in front of a new space with each execution. Does it trigger any excitement to see those imperfect elements? It is dearest to me to see the hearts and rainbows, as two mainstays of the drawings that I keep in folders and count in the hundreds and thousands. Can an algorithm that reproduces those elements trigger the same warm feelings in the viewer? It does with me.

The piece lets the viewer explore certain characteristics. The viewer can pause the iterations: each is just an execution of the same drawing, slightly different. When paused, one can look at each line individually and notice how the drawing is constructed. When running, it gives an idea of how the things we know are just versions of the ideal concept they represent. 

Also, one can have an idea of what would have happened if the child had decided to draw more or less elements. The viewer can press ‚Äúe‚Äù to see different variations of the same piece: random elements are selected and displayed. To restore the original work, press ‚Äúr‚Äù. Which one is the ‚Äúfinished‚Äù artwork? All of them. What is ‚Äúthe‚Äù artwork? 

The work has the following commands:

- Change the work: ‚Äúe‚Äù. To restore: ‚Äúr‚Äù
- The painting can be paused/unpaused pressing ‚Äúp‚Äù
- The viewer can save an artwork pressing ‚Äús‚Äù (it will pause the piece, press "p" to unpause)
- The resolution can be arbitrarily changed pressing ‚Äúd‚Äù followed by a number from 1 to 9. If the image goes dark and nothing paints, press ‚Äúd 0‚Äù (d zero) and try again with a lower number. Resolution can be increased iteratively: press d 2, then d 2, etc. It will always add the amount to the current pixel density, thus increasing resolution.
- The viewer can see how many decisions are made per iteration. This might be interesting to those who don‚Äôt know how generative art works. Each iteration is composed of thousands of decisions that inform colour, positions, shapes, etc. To toggle the decision count view, press ‚Äúq‚Äù
- It has also colour controls: press z for brightness, x for contrast, g for gamma, b for blur, n for noise followed by + or - to alter their values. You might get some simple variations that you might enjoy. Press a to enable/disable all colour controls (except the noise).
- There are some pre-recorded colour variations: press ‚Äúv‚Äù followed by 1, 2 or 3. Press ‚Äúv‚Äù followed by 0 (zero) to reset the variations.

In every process of discovery, one comes to an "aha" moment ;) If you find your aha moment, then you can do one more thing: you can play with the size of certain elements pressing ‚Äúo‚Äù. To restore, reload the piece. Once you find your aha moment, you can go back the same way you got there. All the controls work the same when one has reached their aha moment.

I hope you enjoy the piece as much as I have enjoyed drawing it, directly or indirectly, with my daughters. Thanks.

Artwork by Marcelo Soria-Rodr√≠guez, @msoriaro.
Made with p5js and glsl.

metadata.name: Entropes #90
metadata.description:
Entropes is an abstract generative art project consisting of patterns and textures made with a heuristic rectangle packing algorithm. It‚Äôs a blend of shapes, geometry and colour. It draws notable inspiration from the Bauhaus art style. All these attributes are fused to form aesthetics that create diversity while maintaining cohesiveness across this body of work.

_____________________________________________________________________________________

The details go down to the very last pixel and outputs can be saved right from the browser at a full resolution of 6400 x 9600 pixels which ensures the quality holds up across majority of displays and different print sizes.

_____________________________________________________________________________________

Programmed entirely using p5js.

_____________________________________________________________________________________

A project by Kamau Kamau and Ian Wright

metadata.name: Bloom in the rain #46
metadata.description:
In the oriental ink and wash paintings, the plain nature and the poetic charm are admired. The seemingly lonely scenery can often reflect the noble sentiment of the literati. In this work, I create a poetic, raining scenery by p5.js. I also reproduce the ink rhythm and texture strokes pattern left by the brush on the rice paper. This is my preliminary exploration of generative art with the form and style of oriental aesthetics.

Created purely with p5.js.
For best result, open in live view 
and press [s] to save a png

Features:
1)	pallete: whiteBackground | darkBackground | color ink
2)	rock position: left | center | right 
3)	number of tree: one | two | three
4)	rain: none | drizzle | shower | heavy | extremely heavy
5)	background type: mountain | ocean 
6)	composition: horizontal_long | horizontal | square
7)	invert color: true | false
8)	moon type: full | slender

This is an original work created by Pingyeh Li, Sep 2022.
License: CC BY-NC-SA 4.0 https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-nc-sa/4.0/ - @Pingyeh Li

metadata.name: Nouveau Dillsack #201
metadata.description: You have awakened to discover a proboscum on your mageflap. While this may be frightening at first, once you let go a radiant warmth envelops you - @presstube - James Paterson - fxhash genesis üåü

metadata.name: drawz fxh_t019 #12
metadata.description:
'drawz' fxh_t019 is also vanilla javascript template for fxhash


feel free, to use (parts of) it, and learn from the source.
and use it as a start for your own creative projects and adventures

This version has some extra routines you can use; 
and a lot of comments in the source


A cleaned up - smaller version; just doing the basic tech screen & window-handeling etc. with just drawing dots can be found here.
(and older and newer updated versions)
https://elout.home.xs4all.nl/drawz/


Mostly I start with a clean template; 
then add: copy-paste routines into it. Things I want to use; sprites, text-font, filters, lines, 3D etc. 
Like kinda lego blocks. Some routines I re-use for 30 years now. 
Although often they have changed over time.


Vanilla javascript - And directly control your rgb buffer
-------------------------------------------------------------------
cons:
- can be overwhelming for starting coders compared to p5js
- you have to write / use and tinker with new drawing routines by yourself. 
- still can be optimized a lot, and run much faster
-- (feel free to do that! - release new versions yourself)
- I just coded it in Notepad++ and tested it in a browser.
- I have no experience with git-hub, or those other nifty tools
- I'm more an Artist than a coder, still learning new things as well.
- I have my own 'old' coding style I picked up ages ago, and still use now and then. Started with basic and Z80a as a teenager.
- for sure there are still some stupid bugs, spelling errors in it  ^___^

pros:
- fxtemplate - fxpreview when done drawing / splash-screen support on top; while drawing.
- do like 4000 x 4000 images on safari; on an old Iphone 5
- just 1 index.html now - small file size: 
- the source of the 'cleaned-up' version is now 34b (not minified, and still comments in the source; can be even smaller)
- direct control of the RGB buffer; every pixel.
- I added some basic routines, like drawing points, lines, squares, sprite-brushes, filters, and my pixel-font
- draw, add-mix or subtract - manipulate every pixel how you wish
- I work with a big off-screen kind of image; a rgb-buffer; so drawing goes 'mucho' faster and render it to a screen-scaled image.
- no other libraries used
----------------------------------------------------------------
Mouse-click switches between:
- screen scaled image
- The large image 

- The work will refresh and restart after some time

Save image - with s-key 
(includes the fxhash key-seed and num# of the follow-up images)
--- It can take some seconds before the saving happens; 
--- the browser has to handle (very) large MB .png files first 
--- before it can save them 

- splash image support - to hide drawing at start
- redraw the image after a while; or not.
- mouse position check for the bigger image
- fps counter for testing etc.
----------------------------------------------------------------
written in vanilla JavaScript, more info in the source-code


drawz - latest or an updated version can be found at.
https://elout.home.xs4all.nl/drawz/

It would be nice; to include more routines into it
in the future.

And instead of 1 big library with everything in it
I would like to have these templates; 
where you can add different little snippets and routines 
that you want to use into it, and start playing next.
Still learning new things as well. And getting inspired.

I don't mind people to use the tech-source as a start for their own projects. 

But the palette, and composition & structure build-up; is mine. 
Don't change just 1 or 2 -things then re-release it.

If you want to release something of your own,
your sketch and generative work; really should look total different!
You can use the technics to draw new things,
but you have to start from scratch again; 
choosing points, lines etc. to play with and go from there.
Enjoy! 


-for the love of Art and jumping in rain puddles-

'like jimi and guitar'  0__.  ^____^


xxx  amsterdam  chillout

September 29, 2022

metadata.name: fx(Punk) #1975
metadata.description: fx(Punk) is a .png layered illustration of the Punks which uses PureSpider pfp master code to generate randomized iterations.

metadata.name: In Search of Flowers #22
metadata.description:
During a trip to the OFFF festival in Barcelona, I was inspired to do a piece with circles.
Then I added the drop-like shape and saw that it looked like a flower petal.

Flowers can represent hope, something I‚Äôve been trying to find in my life recently.

The circles, dots and petals are moments of joy and happiness. Time spent with my kids and friends. Perhaps even a new relationship. 
Trying to connect and form a flower, but not quite able to.
Sometimes attracted to the center. Sometimes repelled from it.
Mostly in total chaos, but sometimes in perfect order.

Press ‚ÄúS‚Äù in live mode to save a 1080 x 1080 png.

metadata.name: Colorful Distortion #29
metadata.description:
In this piece I tried to explore a mix between strange shapes and different colors and tried to find a balance between both too. And of course, it's generated in a generative way.

Nothing better than mixing AI + Generative art.

I hope you like it! :D

metadata.name: Ammophila dream #65
metadata.description:
I met an old man at the bar in a pub in Ireland. As it usually happens after a few pints of Guinness we started talking. 

He said how he spent his entire working life on an ocean-going ship, was in danger many times due to storms, and how he couldn't wait to retire and firmly set foot on land, finally spending time with his family, especially grandchildren. 

And that now as an old man, he is happiest on summer evenings, when the full moon lights up everything, he lies out on the grassy part of the beach and looks at the sea through the grass. I asked him why through the grass? He said - "I can't live without the sea, and looking at it through the grass is solid proof that I'm really on land after so many years, and that I'm not dreaming after all." 

This work is a dedication to that old man. I recently found out from my Irish friends that he died few months ago at age of 87. His ashes were scattered on the grassy part of the beach. Now he is forever close to his sea, but still firmly on land, which he has been striving for for years.

Sl√°inte mr. Doyle.

Made in p5.js
Bajiru, November 2022.
